questions.question: 1. What is the most common vector for a malware infection?
options: Email attachments
Social media posts
USB drives
Online advertisements
questions.answer: Email attachments

questions.question: 2. What is the purpose of a firewall in cybersecurity?
options: To prevent physical access to computer systems
To encrypt data during transmission
To block unauthorized network traffic
To detect and remove malware from a system
questions.answer: To block unauthorized network traffic

questions.question: 3. Click on all links and download any attachments to investigate?
options: Mount Kilimanjaro
Forward the email to as many colleagues as possible for awareness
Delete the email immediately without opening any links or attachments
Reply to the email asking for more information
questions.answer: Delete the email immediately without opening any links or attachments

questions.question: 4. What is social engineering in the context of cybersecurity?
options: A type of encryption used to secure data
A method of scanning for vulnerabilities in a network
A technique used to manipulate individuals into revealing sensitive information
A type of antivirus software
questions.answer: A technique used to manipulate individuals into revealing sensitive information

questions.question: 5. What is the purpose of regular software updates and patches?
options: To improve the performance of the software
To add new features to the software
To fix security vulnerabilities in the software
To update the software's user interface
questions.answer: To fix security vulnerabilities in the software

questions.question: 6. What is the purpose of a virtual private network (VPN)?
options: To protect against malware attacks
To encrypt data during transmission
To prevent unauthorized access to a physical location
To monitor network traffic for suspicious activities
questions.answer: To encrypt data during transmission

questions.question: 7. What is a keylogger?
options: A type of virus that spreads through USB drives
A hardware device used to encrypt data
A software that tracks and records keystrokes on a computer
A type of firewall used to block specific websites
questions.answer: A software that tracks and records keystrokes on a computer

questions.question: 8. What is the purpose of a security audit?
options: To test the performance of a network
To assess the effectiveness of security measures
To recover lost data from a system
To install antivirus software on a computer
questions.answer: To assess the effectiveness of security measure

questions.question: 9. What is social media engineering?
options: A method of encrypting data in social media posts
A technique to gain unauthorized access to social media accounts
A process of verifying social media profiles for authenticity
A strategy to improve engagement on social media platforms
questions.answer: A technique to gain unauthorized access to social media accounts

questions.question: 10. What is the best practice for backing up important data?
options: Backing up data on a USB drive and keeping it in the same location as the original data
Backing up data on a cloud-based service with weak or common passwords
Backing up data on an external hard drive and storing it offsite or in a secure location
Not backing up data as it is time-consuming and unnecessary
questions.answer: Backing up data on an external hard drive and storing it offsite or in a secure location

questions.question: 11. What is a DDoS attack?
options: A type of phishing attack
A method of encrypting data during transmission
A type of malware that infects web browsers
A cyber attack that floods a network or website with traffic to overwhelm it
questions.answer: A cyber attack that floods a network or website with traffic to overwhelm it

questions.question: 12. What is the purpose of a security policy?
options: To restrict access to certain websites
To define the rules and guidelines for information security within an organization
To install antivirus software on all devices
To monitor network traffic for suspicious activities
questions.answer: To define the rules and guidelines for information security within an organizationt

questions.question: 13. What is a social media privacy setting?
options: A type of encryption used to protect social media posts
A setting that allows posts to be seen by anyone on the internet
A setting that restricts posts to be visible only to approved friends or connections
A feature to block all social media accounts from accessing a device
questions.answer: A setting that restricts posts to be visible only to approved friends or connections

questions.question: 14. What is the purpose of a VPN tunnel?
options: To encrypt data during transmission
To restrict access to specific websites
To detect and remove malware from a system
To block all incoming and outgoing network traffic
questions.answer: To encrypt data during transmission

questions.question: 15. What is the best practice for handling public Wi-Fi networks?
options: Connect to any available public Wi-Fi network without providing any personal information
Avoid using public Wi-Fi networks as they are not secure
Use a virtual private network (VPN) to encrypt data during transmission
Share personal information freely while using public Wi-Fi networks as they are secure
questions.answer: Use a virtual private network (VPN) to encrypt data during transmission

questions.question: 16. What is the most common type of social engineering attack?
options: Phishing
Malware
DDoS
Spoofing
questions.answer: Phishing

questions.question: 17.What is multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
options: A type of malware that spreads through multiple devices
A method to encrypt data during transmission
A technique used to gain unauthorized access to social media accounts
A security measure that requires multiple forms of authentication to access an account or system
questions.answer: A security measure that requires multiple forms of authentication to access an account or system

questions.question: 18. What is the purpose of a firewall?
options: To block all incoming and outgoing network traffic
To encrypt data during transmission
To restrict access to specific websites
To detect and remove malware from a system
questions.answer: To block all incoming and outgoing network traffic

questions.question: 19. What is the best practice for creating strong passwords?
options: Using simple and easily guessable passwords
Using the same password across multiple accounts
Using a combination of letters, numbers, and special characters
Using only lowercase letters for passwords
questions.answer: Using a combination of letters, numbers, and special characters

questions.question: 20. What is the purpose of a security patch or update?
options: To install new features on a system
To remove all security measures from a system
To fix vulnerabilities and bugs in a system
To slow down the performance of a system
questions.answer: To fix vulnerabilities and bugs in a system
